data.title: Funny Names for Houseplants
data.meta_description: Be a good "parent" and try these unique, funny and cute plant names that work for succulents, indoor trees and more. Take inspo from celebs and even TV shows.
data.text:
From the succulents lining your kitchen windowsill to a snake plant and monstera deliciosa sitting pretty in the living room, your houseplants are more than just decoration. Not only can houseplants improve your health and overall well-being, they often feel like part of the family — especially when you assign them adorable plant names. No matter the size of your indoor plant collection, we encourage proud plant parents to dream up a name for each of their plant babies.

Refer to your prickly cactus as "Spike" or your aloe vera as "Sunny," since it thrives in bright light. Make a pun out of your plant's scientific name, like calling your peperomia plant "Pepper" or keep it literal by dubbing your Venus fly trap "Bug Eater." Try a sweet boy or girl name, like Sweetie, Cutie or Dumpling for your best behaved babies (aka low-maintenance houseplants).

While some of these names cater to certain plant types, most are pretty or punny enough to fit any your houseplants. Think Minnie or Button for your smallest child, plus Honey or Goldie for leafy plants with subtle yellow stripes. Share a laugh every time you refer to a houseplant as Mr. Plant, Salad or Spaghetti (ideal for a trailing plant). Or, model your plant name after your favorite celebrity — wouldn't you love to meet Elvis Parsley or Morgan Treeman?

If you're looking to name a group of herbs, tiny succulents or tall houseplants, scroll to our list of names for groups — which includes Gossip Girls and Charlie's Plants. Now, it's time to scroll our list to find the perfect tile to bestow your precious plants.

Best Plant Names

When in doubt, you can't go wrong with one of these classic plant names — whether you're inspired by its size and appearance (like its small stems, spiky leaves or unique color pattern), or you prefer a lovable nickname.

Bean

Bud

Button (small succulent)

Cutie

Dumpling

Elm

Herb

Leaf

Lucky (money trees and other Feng Shui plants)

Prickles (cactus)

Spike (cactus or snake plant)

Sprout

Sunny

Sweetie

Cute Plant Names

Sweet and simple just like your houseplant. Choose a name inspired by its natural color (possibly green, red or yellow) or plant species. Or, play around with a Greek, Spanish or Latin word that translates to something relevant (like Verde, which means green in Spanish).

Bugsy

Bug Eater (Venus fly trap)

Chloe, means "green shoot" in Greek

Emerald

Esmeralda, means "emerald" in Spanish

Fern

Flora

Goldie

Honey

Hunter

Jade

Lily (peace lily)

Minnie

Majesty

Noodle

Minnie

Olive

Pearl (string of pearls)

Penny

Pepper (Peperomia plants)

Ruby

Sage

Salad

Succa (succulent)

Sylvia/Sylvie, means "forest" in Latin

Vera (aloe vera plant)

Verde, means "green" in Spanish

Willow

Funny Plant Names

Your plant has its quirks and its name should reflect that. There are a few punny monikers to choose from, as well as some that are just plain ironic (which makes them equally as funny).

Bill (money plant)

Christofern (fern plant)

Dr. Plant

The Duke or Duchess of Plant

Fluffy (cactus)

Hot Dog (Dragon fingers)

Justice Plant

Lil Plant

Mr. Plant

Mrs. Plant

Mr. Prickles (cactus)

Planty

Pokey

President Plant

Professor Plant

Spaghetti (trailing succulents and ferns)

Woody (indoor tree)

Celebrity Plant Names

Take inspiration from pop culture — musicians, actors, politicians, artists and film characters — with one of these punny takes on a celebrity name. Some group names even work for plant families.

Bella Thorn

Blue Ivy

Cactus Everdeen (cactus)

Count Plantula

Dobby the Houseplant

Elvis Parsley (herb plant)

Fernie Sanders

Flaura Croft

Kate Moss

Megan Thee Plant

Miley Cyprus

Morgan Treeman (indoor tree)

Oompa Loompa

Orlando Bloom

Shrek

Sir Pokes-a-Lot (cactus)

Spice Girls (a group of herb plants)

Snake Gyllenhaal (snake plant)

Spice Girls (a group of herb plants)

Spike Leaf

Tree Diddy

Tony the Tiger (striped snake plant)

Vincent Van Grow

Plant Names for Groups

If you have more than one plant growing, brainstorm a nickname for all of them. Take inspiration from your favorite movies, TV shows and musicians.
